result.name: exclusion-appeals
result.notes:
The appeals against exclusions  independent review survey is a statutory annual collection of information from local authorities on the number of independent reviews and their outcome as part of a continuing review of exclusion policies and practice.
Local authorities collect the data from all maintained primary, secondary and special schools as well as Pupil Referral Units and academies.
The latest data available is for 2011 and 2012 academic year and is updated annually.  Reports are available going back to 2008 and 2009 academic year.

organization.name: department-for-education
organization.title: Department for Education
organization.description:
The Department for Education is responsible for education and children’s services in England. We work to achieve a highly educated society in which opportunity is equal for children and young people, no matter what their background or family circumstances.
DfE is a ministerial department, supported by 9 agencies and public bodies.

https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-education

result.title: Exclusion Appeals

extras.value:
National data are currently published. Local Authority level data, the level at which the data are collected will be published as underlying data in the 'Permanent and fixed period exclusions from schools in England' Statistical First Release.
Information from academies will be collected for the first time in the January 2014 collection.
Last published 25 July 2013
